column1: WARM TO THE TOUCH, RED, OR PAINFUL BREAST This is almost always caused by an infection in your breast.
An infection in the breast or inflammatory breast cancer can cause this problem.
Your health care provider will talk to you about your medical history and recent changes you have noticed in your breasts and nipples.
Your provider will also do a breast exam and may suggest that you see a skin doctor (dermatologist) or breast specialist.
